thread.title: Cameras roll for second series of ITV's 'Grantchester'
thread.title_full: Cameras roll for second series of ITV's 'Grantchester' | Anglia - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Cameras roll for second series of ITV's 'Grantchester'
text:
ITV News Anglia's Claire McGlasson with Robson Green and James Norton Credit: ITV News Anglia Cameras are rolling in Cambridge for the second series of the ITV drama Grantchester.
James Norton and Robson Green are back as vicar Sidney Chambers and Police Inspector Geordie Keating.
After the success of the first series, the 1950s crime drama will be back on our screens early next year.
The show’s stars have already been spotted shooting scenes in Cambridge city centre and now filming has begun again in Grantchester.
Locals are once again appearing as extras in the episodes and buildings too are being taken back to the 1950s.
We, the cast, call Grantchester our happy place because it just a joy to work on the programme and where better to film Grantchester than Grantchester! A beautiful, quintessentially English, tranquil backdrop. Perfect for picnics… and murder!”
– Robson Green, Actor 'Supporting actors' who all live in Grantchester Credit: ITV News Anglia "The villagers are so welcoming and they are so proud of this place. You can see why. It’s a lovely, beautiful little village."
– James Norton, Actor Tessa Peake-Jones, Kacey Ainsworth and Al Weaver are back and actors Neil Morrissey and Paul Nicholls are joining the cast.
Producer Emma Kingsman-Lloyd said the themes would be “a little darker” this series, as Sidney and Geordie disagree about moral questions like the death penalty.
Producers have commissioned a headstone to be erected in Grantchester churchyard for the filming.
It marks the grave of one of the characters but which one? That will remain a mystery until the drama is aired next year.
Watch Claire McGlasson's report below.
